txt.en: 'Traders from the western towns were once a common sight along the road to Harwick. Of late, the troubles befalling Thane Mildrith and the people of Elthengels seems to have stalled all travel from that once calm land.\n\n'The loss of supplies from the Norcrofts will have a terrible impact on us all. If you desire to offer your skills to Mildrith and her people, travel with haste, due west along the road.'

'Welcome to Elthengels, traveller. I must ask your pardon for the sorrowful state of matters. We mourn for the former Thane, my husband Pendrad, and our son Pendulf. Do not feel obligated to grieve on our behalf; it will help matters not for you to dwell in sadness.'

The presence of traders from the town of Elthengels to Harwick has been all but extinguished. Etta worries that the tragedies befalling Thane Mildrith of Elthengels have thrown the farmers of the Norcrofts into a state of peril.
Speak with Thane Mildrith of Elthengels, in the Norcrofts
Thane Mildrith resides in the town of Elthengels, in the Norcrofts, south-west along the road from Floodwend.\n\nEtta has suggested that you lend aid to Thane Mildrith of Elthengels.
